column8: Integrate IDR info (number, equipment, location, circuit, voltage) and establish mapping to dip events.

column8: Use AI on historical DTx loading waveforms to filter repetitive operational patterns.

column5: As a user, I need to see configurable pop-up messages on the front page, so that I can be notified of important system announcements.
column8: System displays pop-up widget on front page with configurable messages, allowing administrators to input messages to be shown.

As a user, I need to generate supply reliability reports with detailed transmission and distribution system fault information, so that I can analyze system performance and reliability.
column8: System generates supply reliability reports with detailed information including IDR number, date, time, building type, voltage level, remaining voltage, circuit, faulty phase, duration, region, weather, equipment category, cause, and damage codes.

column5: As a user, I need to generate annual power quality performance reports compliant with supply rules, EN50160, IEEE519, IEC61000-2, and supply code, so that I can demonstrate compliance with industry standards.
column8: System generates annual power quality performance reports incorporating standards including supply rules, EN50160, IEEE519, IEC61000-2, and supply code for compliance verification.

column5: As a user, I need a weekly EN50160 report so that I could analyze the weekly performance.
column8: Generate 7-day compliance analysis per EN50160.

Voltage, Current, Power Factor, Individual harmonic, TDD (Total Demand Distortion), THDI (Total Harmonic Distortion of Current), THDV (Total Harmonic Distortion of Voltage), Voltage Deviation, Flickering and other characteristics specified in the EN50160 standard.

column5: As a user, I need to generate reports on meter data and communication availability, so that I can monitor and gain insight of meter infrastructure performance.
column8: System generates reports consolidating meter data and communication availability with insights into meter infrastructure performance, data availability, communication status, and relevant metrics.

column5: As a user, I need to maintain comprehensive and up-to-date meter inventory synchronized with PQMS, CPDIS, and ERP Enlight with daily updates, so that I can track all meter assets accurately.
column8: Include asset no., serial no., IP, MAC, longitude, latitude, SCADA code, brand, model, circuit, voltage, substation, location, etc.; sync with PQMS/CPDIS.

column5: As a user, I need to view updated meter status category from PQMS and CPDIS, so that I can quickly identify and monitor meter functionality.
column8: System provides updated information for each meter from PQMS and CPDIS, categorizing as active (operational), abnormal (with issues requiring attention), or inactive (temporarily out of service).

column5: As a user, I need the ability to ignore overcurrent signals for meters with unavailable or malfunctioning current transformers, so that voltage dip events are not overlooked.
column8: System includes feature allowing users to ignore overcurrent signal of each meter, preventing system from overlooking voltage dip events due to missing or faulty current detection devices.

column5: As a user, I need to view meter locations on a map with building types, meter types, connection status, event alerts, and filtering options, so that I can visualize meter distribution and identify actual event locations.
column8: System includes map view displaying geographical meter locations with building types, meter types, connection status, event alerts, event information (e.g., voltage dip frequency), with filter options and search function by building type, meter status, voltage level.

column5: As a user, I need to maintain a log of meter activities and events including measurements, communication events, and alarms, so that I can review historical meter operations.
column8: System maintains log of meter activities and events providing historical record of meter operations including measurements, communication events, alarms, and significant events.

column5: As a user, the system should provide event notifications with detail by SMS and email so that I don't need to always login system for get updated.
column8: Event notifications with attachment of related voltage dip waveform

column5: As a user, I need only the mother event to trigger notifications when multiple events are grouped, so that I avoid duplicate notification for the same incident.
column8: Based on mother event list, system identifies primary event and only first event triggers notification function.

column5: As a user, I need to have system interfaces with SMS and email alerts, so that I can quickly notified to fix abnormalities.
column8: Detect abnormalities by watchdog from across system components and interfaces; send SMS/email to admin group.

column5: As a user, I need to enable/disable notifications during maintenance or unexpected incidents and set maintenance periods, so that I can avoid unnecessary alerts during maintenance activities.
column8: System provides functionality to enable/disable notifications during maintenance or unexpected incidents, allowing users to set specific maintenance periods within PQMAP ensuring no events or notifications triggered during these times.
column9: Time configure is a timer which active when mode is on? And turn the mode off when timer runs out.

column5: As a system admin, I need a typhoon mode toggle while continuing to record events, so that I can avoid notification overload during typhoon periods.
column8: System includes typhoon mode to disable SMS, XML/API, and email notifications while continuously recording events with detailed information during typhoon signal, allowing users to manually define the duration.

column5: As an admin, I need to suppress notifications for voltage dips received beyond a configurable time so that to avoid sending outdated alerts repeatedly.
column8: System suppresses sending XML/API, SMS, and email notifications for voltage dips received more than a configurable number of hours after occurrence.
column9: The purpose is avoiding outdated notification send multiple times?

column5: As a user, I need configurable notification templates for various events based on specific thresholds and alarms, so that I can ensure timely and accurate communication.
column8: System provides configurable notification templates for various events and conditions, sending notifications based on specific thresholds, alarms, or events for timely communication to stakeholders.

column5: As a system admin, I want to select the audiences and channels for notification so that I can customize notification preferences.
column8: System allows users to specify and select which accounts receive various notification options including all types, SMS only, email only, summary table only.

column5: As a system admin, I want to set rules to send notification so that I could control when notification are sent.
column8: System allows users to configure specific conditions for sending XML, SMS, and email including building type (11kV/132kV/400kV/other), voltage level, duration, notification processing time, threshold, alarms, or events and scheduled sending.

column5: As a system admin, I want the system integrated to the PQMS/CPIDS so that  I can process voltage dip files from OT.
column8: Process files containing per-phase dip level, duration, location/SCADA code and details transmitted to system.

column5: As a system, I want the system integrated to PQDA, so that the system ingest PQ service data.
column8: Collect PQ service data via file/API and process.

column5: As a user, I need to view the detailed information of the PQ service so that I can maintain comprehensive service records.
column8: System integrates with PQDA to collect PQ service data with detailed information including customer name, date of service, affected equipment, service type, finding, and recommendation.

column5: As a user, I need the system to integrate with ADMS to collect and validate voltage dip events, so that I can ensure event data accuracy through cross-system verification.
column8: System integrates with ADMS to collect and process voltage dip event information, establishing validation function to verify and compare events and present validated data on dashboard.

column5: As a user, I need PQMAP integrate with GIS & Enlight, so that I can map determine affected customers when events occur.
column8: System integrates with ERP Enlight, ADMS, GIS to collect, display and map relationships between customer (account number), transformers, and voltage dip sensitive customers, calculating weight factors (number of customers per transformer).

column5: As a user, I need the system integrate to Twilio so that I could send SMS to stakeholders.
As a user, I need the system integrate to SMTP server so that I could send emails to stakeholders.

column8: System monitors system healthiness continuously to all interfacing systems, checking regular health check and interfacing files, generating alerts with meter details (name, ID, location, brand, model) to administrators when no file received within defined timeframe.

column5: As a user, I need alerts for disconnection, so that I am informed to fix the issue immediately.

column8: System supports user profile management allowing administrators to create, modify, and control user access levels and privileges, with profiles associated with specific roles (administrators, operators, general users, report viewers).

column5: As a user, I need the system to generate XML/API files containing event information for transmission to other CLP systems, so that I can enable seamless integration and information exchange.

column5: Purpose
column8: Detail

column5: As a user, I need the system to collect and process industry standard file formats (PQDIF, COMTRADE, CSV, XML), so that I can integrate data from various PQ measurement devices.
column8: System collects industry standard file formats including PQDIF, COMTRADE, CSV, XML, capturing and storing relevant power quality parameters and waveform data, then presenting on the system.

column5: As a user, I need the system to collect and process voltage dip files (XML, PQDIF) from broker servers when voltage dips occur, so that event information is promptly transmitted and processed.
column8: System collects voltage dip files (XML, PQDIF) from broker servers (PQMS, CPDIS) in OT zone, processing files containing voltage dip level per phase, dip duration, location/SCADA code, and other details.

column5: As a user, I need the system to collect PQ service data from PQDA in File/API format, so that service history can be integrated into the platform.
column8: System collects PQ service data from PQDA in File/API format and processes the data.
